lines.text: [Buck's men encounter a slave for the first time]
My, my. You're a long way from home.
We're going to be longer. We're headed for Virginia.
Ain't that nice.
You know, where the war is. We're goin' to fight Yankees.
I hear tell the Yankees is fightin' us. I hear tell they're mighty mean! Oh, I reckon we'll whip 'em.
We?
Yessir - us Southerners.
[Buck's men have been thrown out of an elegant party because of their ragged buckskin clothing]
As an Alabama patriot, I implore you to come back inside.
Oh, I don't think we'll do that ma'am. A man can get bit once by a rattler by accident; if he gets bit twice, well, that's just bein' stupid.
Then please accept my apology and my gratitude for the brave and noble thing you're doin'. I mean that from the bottom of my heart.

Ma'am, we don't know much about this here war, but as long as there are ladies like you that support it like you do, then I'm sure we'll win. We'll remember what you said when we get to war. It'll help us from bein' tired.
Buck, this whole thing ain't workin' out.
Yeah! We're horse soldiers and they got us scratchin' gravel.
You know, I been thinkin'. I ain't got a thing against a Yankee. I never seen one.
Well, this is war. We're Southerners; we gotta fight. It's a matter of freedom.
Whose freedom? Like that slave we took in, Buck? Look what happened to him!
What happened to him?
Never you mind, Eubie.
No, I want to know what happened to him.
They hung him!
We got a Yank in here?

Now, Texas, there's an old sayin' among soldiers - when the minie balls is flyin' and the artillery is hotter than hell, there ain't no such thing as an enemy. Besides he was here in first - it don't seem neighborly to throw him out now.
Todo, Eubie, Little Bit, Willie Bill, J.C. - they're all dead. We didn't make of a splash, did we?
